intro: Tricoryne elatior, commonly known as the tall tricoryne, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while the flowers are clustered in umbels. Tricoryne elatior is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
